results.title: The Long Good Friday
results.creator_credit: John Mackenzie, Barry Hanson, Calendar and HandMade Films
results.brief_description: In the savage and deadly world of gangland kings, the man at the top is the ruler, only for as long as he controls everything in his territory. For that man, the rewards are infinite - but so are the dangers. Harold Shand, played by Bob Hoskins, London racketeer, is at the peak of his powers. He is on the verge of a major deal with some Americans, to finance the total redevelopment of the London docklands into an enormous leisure complex. But on one long, never-ending day of terror, Good Friday, he is to see his empire crack and crumble. Co-starring Helen Mirren.

results.title: Hairspray
results.creator_credit: John Waters, Rachel Talalay and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: The frenzied, all-out dancing, all rockin’ rememberance of Baltimore 1962. A time infested with glamour crazed teens to whom TV was everything. Featuring an electric combination of talents that include Divine, Sonny Bono and Debbie Harry, set around Baltimore’s coolest pop show, “The Corny Collins Show”. Happy teen viewers thrill to watching their towns’ coolest teens rock to the country’s trendiest new dances. One such viewer is Tracy Turnblad, a tubby teenager who lives her dream by getting her big shot on the show. However, Tracy finds herself in bitter competition with the show’s reigning teen queen, bitchy Amber Von Tussle. They battle not only for the crown but also for the true love of teen hunk, Link.

results.title: Zazie Dans le Metro = Zazie in the Subway
results.brief_description:
Precocious, foul-mouthed pre-teen Zazie spends three days with her female impersonator uncle Gabriel in Paris with the sole intention of riding the Metro. But everything conspires against her.

Credits: Director, Louis Malle ; writers, Louis Malle, Jean-Paul Rappeneau ; photography, Henri Raichi ; music, Fiorenzo Carpi ; art direction, Bernard Evein.
Cast: Philippe Noiret, Catherine Demongeot, Hubert Deschamps, Jacques Dufilho, Annie Fratellini.

results.title: A Tale of springtime = Conte de printemps
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
The first in a series of films by Eric Rohmer based on the four seasons, “Le Conte de printemps” is essentially a chamber piece about the interaction of six characters (one of whom never appears). The characters are made up of three couples, whose centre is the developing friendship between the cerebral Jeanne and the instinctive Natasha. Rohmer’s visual style is restrained and unobtrusive, but also gloriously cinematic. There are flowers blooming everywhere, signs of rebirth, of hope, of the opportunites that life has to offer, and teasingly, the possibilities that lie just beyond the grasp of the flawed humanity that populates this film. Cast includes Anne Teyssedre, Hugues Quester, Florence Darel, Eloise Bennett, Sophie Robin.

results.title: The Ladykillers
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Sir Michael Balcon, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A black comedy from the Ealing Studios which features Alec Guinness and Peter Sellers. An innocent little old lady who takes in a sinister lodger finds out that he and four friends have committed a robbery. Once they realise she knows everything, they plot to kill her. However, just because she is the archetypal genteel old lady pensioner, doesn’t mean that she is quite as harmless as she seems. Also stars Jack Warner, Katie Johnson and Frankie Howerd.

results.title: The Sailor who fell from grace with the sea
results.creator_credit: Lewis John Carlino, Martin Poll, Sailor Company and Haworth Productions
results.brief_description: A disturbing adaption of the famous Japanese novel by Yukio Mishima. A troubled, impressionable boy’s idealistic attachment to his beautiful widowed mother is threatened when the perfection of that love is sullied by her love affair with an amiable sailor. He falls under the influence of a morbid young friend who is a member of a secret circle of sadistic schoolboys who follow a moral code that leads them to torture and dissect what they consider to be “imperfect.” Initially, they only inflict their bloody justice on animals but the “charges” against persons are mounting, and the shcoolboys code must be obeyed. Passionate love scenes and a bizzare ending highlight this unusual film, beautifully shot by Douglas Slocombe on English sea coast locations with music composed by John Mandel. Starring Sarah Miles, Kris Kristofferson, Jonathan Kahn, Margo Cunningham and Earl Rhodes.

results.title: Le Cheval D'orgueil = the Horse of Pride
results.creator_credit: Georges de Beauregard and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description:
Between 1908 and 1918, Pierre-Jakez Helias spent his childhood in Bigouden country (French Brittany). The First World War brings about many changes in the traditional life of a village where pride is more abundant than riches. The central theme of the film is the perpetuation of Brittany’s culture (and language) via oral, rather than written tradition.

Credits: Producer, Georges de Beauregard ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writer, Daniel Boulanger ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen ; art direction, Hilton McConnico.
Cast: Jacques Dufilho, Bernadette Le Sache, Francois Cluzet, Dominique Lavanant, Michel Blanc, Paul Le Person, Michel Robin, Georges Wilson [narration only].

results.title: La Cite de L'indicible Peur
results.brief_description:
Mickey, a dangerous mobster, has been arrested ‘by chance’ by Triquet, a rather insignificant police officer. Mickey is condemned to death but manages to escape. Triquet is ordered to trace him all the way to the village of Barges in Auvergne (central France).

Credits: Producer, Paul Laffargue ; director, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; writers, Jean-Pierre Mocky, Gerard Klein ; photography, Eugen Schuftan ; music, Gerard Calvi ; editor, Marguerite Renoir.
Cast: Bourvil, Jean-Louis Barrault, Francis Blanche, Veronique Nordey, Jacques Dufilho, Rene-Louis Lafforgue, Jean Poiret, Raymond Rouleau.

results.title: Autumn sonata
results.brief_description: The reunion of an internationally famous concert pianist and her married daughter begins on a hopeful note, but too many old hurts and bitter memories conflict with their love for each other. Long-buried resentments between mother and daughter soon explode in a shattering confrontation of painful truths. Starring Ingrid Bergman and Liv Ullman.

results.title: Interdit Aux Moins de 13 Ans = Forbidden to Those Under 13
results.brief_description:
Louis lives a mournful existence in a sad-looking suburb with a wife who refuses to even talk to him. His dream is to drive a truck all the way to Lebanon, but he has no money. One way to finance his dream would be to rob the local supermarket.

Credits: Producers, Klaus Hellwig ; director, Jean-Louis Bertucelli ; writers, Jean-Louis Bertucelli, Sandra Majerowicz ; photography, Jean-Francois Robin ; music, Gabriel Yared.
Cast: Patrick Depeyrrat, Sandra Montaigu, Akim Oumaouche, Marilyn Even, Andre Chaumeau.
